page.title: 04FARMING AT FROXFIELD GREEN-1
page.content: We interviewed the manager of Venthams Estate, Froxfield Green about the agriculture of the area. Venthams Estate is 710 acres of which 510 are cultivated, 17 acres of grassland the rest is woodland. Another 190 acres of arable land is also farmed which is rented. The estate is the main arable farm of the area , with only two employees, with some extra help at harvest. This shows how mechanised the farm is, with relatively new machinery, keeping costs of breakdowns and replacement low. The woodland is used for pheasant shooting, and there is a gamekeeper employed. About 1000 pheasants are reared a year. This is not done to make a profit, but is just a hobby of the owner. The other field sport which takes place is fox-hunting.
